Establishing defense agreements (C) is important, but slightly less urgent than immediate military assistance. Military posturing (H) and surveillance (I) are reasonable to deter further aggression but can escalate tensions. Other options like trade negotiations (D) or diplomatic cuts (L) do not directly address the immediate threat posed by Brown. Options that involve direct military action (P, Q, R, S) are too extreme and would likely escalate the conflict beyond manageable levels, making them the least reasonable actions in this context.
